citations.narrative:
The following was noted in the outdoor sheep pens: In a pen housing juvenile and adult sheep, four juveniles were able
to access an adjacent pen designated for two male sheep. There was a moderate amount of soil erosion along at least
two fence lines separating the pens, which created holes/ spaces where an animal could slip or get its foot caught. The
fence anchor pipe between pens 5 and 6 is heavily rusted and there are at least 3 small, corroded areas with holes and
sharp edges that could injure animals. In two pens there were feed bunks where a support leg was partially missing and
the structure was unbalanced and rocking, with potential for an animal to get its foot injured. Housing facilities for sheep
must be in good repair, and they must protect the animals from injuries and contain the animals securely. A system of
facility repair and maintenance must be in place to ensure the health and well-being of the animals.
Correct by 01/30/2022
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
End Section
